contests.title: 100: Auditor Lieutenant Governor Attorney General Lieutenant Governor Attorney General Auditor Vice
contests.description:
10000: Measure 2024-XYZ proposes a multi-faceted approach to address environmental sustainability, infrastructure enhancement, and public health within the state. This measure aims to establish a framework for advancing clean energy, upgrading public transportation, and investing in water conservation and management projects. It also includes provisions for educational programs on sustainability and incentives for local businesses to adopt green practices.

Clean Energy Development Fund:

a. Establishment: A Clean Energy Development Fund (CEDF) will be created, financed by a 0.5% increase in the state’s renewable energy tax on large corporations and a one-time allocation of $1.5 billion from the state’s general fund.

b. Purpose: The fund will support the development and implementation of solar, wind, and geothermal energy projects. Additionally, it will provide grants for research into emerging clean energy technologies.

c. Allocation: 40% of the fund will be allocated to solar energy projects, 30% to wind energy projects, 20% to geothermal energy projects, and 10% to research and development.

Public Transportation Enhancement Initiative:

a. Infrastructure Upgrades: An investment of $2 billion over the next ten years will be allocated for upgrading and expanding public transportation systems, including buses, trains, and light rail networks.

b. Sustainability Measures: All new public transportation infrastructure must adhere to green building standards, including energy-efficient designs and the use of recycled materials.

c. Accessibility Improvements: A portion of the funds will be dedicated to improving accessibility for disabled individuals and enhancing the integration of transportation services with major urban and suburban areas.

Water Conservation and Management Plan:

a. Statewide Water Conservation Program: A $1 billion allocation will be made to implement water conservation measures and improve water management systems. This includes upgrading infrastructure to reduce leakage, investing in water recycling technologies, and supporting drought-resistant landscaping initiatives.

b. Education and Outreach: The program will fund public education campaigns on water conservation practices and provide subsidies for water-efficient appliances for households and businesses.

c. Emergency Response Fund: A portion of the funds will be reserved for emergency responses to water shortages and natural disasters related to water issues.

contests.title: 100: Secretary of State Judge Superintendent Mayor Board Member Treasurer Superintendent Superintend
contests.description:
10000: Measure 2024-XYZ proposes a multi-faceted approach to address environmental sustainability, infrastructure enhancement, and public health within the state. This measure aims to establish a framework for advancing clean energy, upgrading public transportation, and investing in water conservation and management projects. It also includes provisions for educational programs on sustainability and incentives for local businesses to adopt green practices.

Clean Energy Development Fund:

a. Establishment: A Clean Energy Development Fund (CEDF) will be created, financed by a 0.5% increase in the state’s renewable energy tax on large corporations and a one-time allocation of $1.5 billion from the state’s general fund.

b. Purpose: The fund will support the development and implementation of solar, wind, and geothermal energy projects. Additionally, it will provide grants for research into emerging clean energy technologies.

c. Allocation: 40% of the fund will be allocated to solar energy projects, 30% to wind energy projects, 20% to geothermal energy projects, and 10% to research and development.

Public Transportation Enhancement Initiative:

a. Infrastructure Upgrades: An investment of $2 billion over the next ten years will be allocated for upgrading and expanding public transportation systems, including buses, trains, and light rail networks.

b. Sustainability Measures: All new public transportation infrastructure must adhere to green building standards, including energy-efficient designs and the use of recycled materials.

c. Accessibility Improvements: A portion of the funds will be dedicated to improving accessibility for disabled individuals and enhancing the integration of transportation services with major urban and suburban areas.

Water Conservation and Management Plan:

a. Statewide Water Conservation Program: A $1 billion allocation will be made to implement water conservation measures and improve water management systems. This includes upgrading infrastructure to reduce leakage, investing in water recycling technologies, and supporting drought-resistant landscaping initiatives.

b. Education and Outreach: The program will fund public education campaigns on water conservation practices and provide subsidies for water-efficient appliances for households and businesses.

c. Emergency Response Fund: A portion of the funds will be reserved for emergency responses to water shortages and natural disasters related to water issues.

contests.title: 100: Council Member Lieutenant Governor Vice President Council Member Vice President Judge Vice Pres
contests.description:
10000: Measure 2024-XYZ proposes a multi-faceted approach to address environmental sustainability, infrastructure enhancement, and public health within the state. This measure aims to establish a framework for advancing clean energy, upgrading public transportation, and investing in water conservation and management projects. It also includes provisions for educational programs on sustainability and incentives for local businesses to adopt green practices.

Clean Energy Development Fund:

a. Establishment: A Clean Energy Development Fund (CEDF) will be created, financed by a 0.5% increase in the state’s renewable energy tax on large corporations and a one-time allocation of $1.5 billion from the state’s general fund.

b. Purpose: The fund will support the development and implementation of solar, wind, and geothermal energy projects. Additionally, it will provide grants for research into emerging clean energy technologies.

c. Allocation: 40% of the fund will be allocated to solar energy projects, 30% to wind energy projects, 20% to geothermal energy projects, and 10% to research and development.

Public Transportation Enhancement Initiative:

a. Infrastructure Upgrades: An investment of $2 billion over the next ten years will be allocated for upgrading and expanding public transportation systems, including buses, trains, and light rail networks.

b. Sustainability Measures: All new public transportation infrastructure must adhere to green building standards, including energy-efficient designs and the use of recycled materials.

c. Accessibility Improvements: A portion of the funds will be dedicated to improving accessibility for disabled individuals and enhancing the integration of transportation services with major urban and suburban areas.

Water Conservation and Management Plan:

a. Statewide Water Conservation Program: A $1 billion allocation will be made to implement water conservation measures and improve water management systems. This includes upgrading infrastructure to reduce leakage, investing in water recycling technologies, and supporting drought-resistant landscaping initiatives.

b. Education and Outreach: The program will fund public education campaigns on water conservation practices and provide subsidies for water-efficient appliances for households and businesses.

c. Emergency Response Fund: A portion of the funds will be reserved for emergency responses to water shortages and natural disasters related to water issues.

contests.title: 100: Sheriff Governor Attorney General Vice President Attorney General Governor Secretary of State A
contests.description:
10000: Measure 2024-XYZ proposes a multi-faceted approach to address environmental sustainability, infrastructure enhancement, and public health within the state. This measure aims to establish a framework for advancing clean energy, upgrading public transportation, and investing in water conservation and management projects. It also includes provisions for educational programs on sustainability and incentives for local businesses to adopt green practices.

Clean Energy Development Fund:

a. Establishment: A Clean Energy Development Fund (CEDF) will be created, financed by a 0.5% increase in the state’s renewable energy tax on large corporations and a one-time allocation of $1.5 billion from the state’s general fund.

b. Purpose: The fund will support the development and implementation of solar, wind, and geothermal energy projects. Additionally, it will provide grants for research into emerging clean energy technologies.

c. Allocation: 40% of the fund will be allocated to solar energy projects, 30% to wind energy projects, 20% to geothermal energy projects, and 10% to research and development.

Public Transportation Enhancement Initiative:

a. Infrastructure Upgrades: An investment of $2 billion over the next ten years will be allocated for upgrading and expanding public transportation systems, including buses, trains, and light rail networks.

b. Sustainability Measures: All new public transportation infrastructure must adhere to green building standards, including energy-efficient designs and the use of recycled materials.

c. Accessibility Improvements: A portion of the funds will be dedicated to improving accessibility for disabled individuals and enhancing the integration of transportation services with major urban and suburban areas.

Water Conservation and Management Plan:

a. Statewide Water Conservation Program: A $1 billion allocation will be made to implement water conservation measures and improve water management systems. This includes upgrading infrastructure to reduce leakage, investing in water recycling technologies, and supporting drought-resistant landscaping initiatives.

b. Education and Outreach: The program will fund public education campaigns on water conservation practices and provide subsidies for water-efficient appliances for households and businesses.

c. Emergency Response Fund: A portion of the funds will be reserved for emergency responses to water shortages and natural disasters related to water issues.

This measure aims to establish a framework for advancing clean energy, upgrading public transportation, and investing in water conservation and management projects. It also includes provisions for educational programs on sustainability and incentives for local businesses to adopt green practices.

Clean Energy Development Fund:

a. Establishment: A Clean Energy Development Fund (CEDF) will be created, financed by a 0.5% increase in the state’s renewable energy tax on large corporations and a one-time allocation of $1.5 billion from the state’s general fund.

b. Purpose: The fund will support the development and implementation of solar, wind, and geothermal energy projects. Additionally, it will provide grants for research into emerging clean energy technologies.

c. Allocation: 40% of the fund will be allocated to solar energy projects, 30% to wind energy projects, 20% to geothermal energy projects, and 10% to research and development.

Public Transportation Enhancement Initiative:

a. Infrastructure Upgrades: An investment of $2 billion over the next ten years will be allocated for upgrading and expanding public transportation systems, including buses, trains, and light rail networks.

b. Sustainability Measures: All new public transportation infrastructure must adhere to green building standards, including energy-efficient designs and the use of recycled materials.

c. Accessibility Improvements: A portion of the funds will be dedicated to improving accessibility for disabled individuals and enhancing the integration of transportation services with major urban and suburban areas.

Water Conservation and Management Plan:

a. Statewide Water Conservation Program: A $1 billion allocation will be made to implement water conservation measures and improve water management systems. This includes upgrading infrastructure to reduce leakage, investing in water recycling technologies, and supporting drought-resistant landscaping initiatives.

b. Education and Outreach: The program will fund public education campaigns on water conservation practices and provide subsidies for water-efficient appliances for households and businesses.

c. Emergency Response Fund: A portion of the funds will be reserved for emergency responses to water shortages and natural disasters related to water issues.
